intro: Helipterum ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and the flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Helipterum ferrugineum is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
